nodes.text: That is why the DPJ should consider the Hatoyama resignation in the broader context of a political reorganization.
As a result politics may lose some of its vital flexibility to the detriment of sound parliamentary democracy in Japan
If the consequences of a fact are at serious for political life the fact is serious for political life
The DPJ crisis is also likely to have an effect on other opposition parties
Democracy is based on the possibility of choice between parties with a different program
If there is a too strong party the democracy will be affected by that
A weakening of opposition ranks already evident in the Diet and elsewhere will further embolden the ruling parties.
If the opposition is weakened the party is stenghten
the public's disappointment with the DPJ will lead to an erosion of confidence in the opposition camp as a whole
If the leading party of a coalition is discredited the whole coalition it belongs to is dicredited
